intro: Ibervillea sonorae, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its showy, yellow or orange flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant has a distinctive spherical shape, with thick, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in arid environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in desert scrub and rocky habitats. Ibervillea sonorae is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and is an important species for pollinators in its native range.
